July 17, 1994: Fiction
THE CHAMBER, by John Grisham. (Doubleday, $24.95.) A lawyer represents a
racist who is on death row for his part in a 1967 bombing in Mississippi.
THE CELESTINE PROPHECY, by James Redfield. (Warner, $17.95.) An ancient
manuscript, found in Peru, provides insights into achieving a fulfilling life.
THE CROSSING, by Cormac McCarthy. (Knopf, $23.) A young American comes
of age in Mexico's sierra.
THE ALIENIST, by Caleb Carr. (Random House, $22.) A journalist and a
psychologist track down a murderer in turn-of-the-century Manhattan.
POLITICALLY CORRECT BEDTIME STORIES, by James Finn Garner.
(Macmillan, $8.95.) Classic tales respun to avoid offending current sensibilities.
THE BRIDGES OF MADISON COUNTY, by Robert James Waller. (Warner,
$16.95.) A photographer and a farmer's lonely wife in Iowa.
REMEMBER ME, by Mary Higgins Clark. (Simon & Schuster, $23.50.) After an
estranged couple reconcile, they find themselves haunted by a mysterious force.
THE WATERWORKS, by E.L. Doctorow. (Random House, $23.) Life in the New
York City of 1871 as witnessed by a jaded newspaperman.
INCA GOLD, by Clive Cussler. (Simon & Schuster, $24.) Dirk Pitt contends with a
ring of thieves.
DOWNTOWN, by Anne Rivers Siddons. (HarperCollins, $24.) A woman learns
about life and the ways of men in Atlanta during the 1960's.
OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO! by Dr. Seuss. (Random House, $15.) Verse and
pictures.
THE DAY AFTER TOMORROW, by Allan Folsom. (Little, Brown, $24.95.) A
young doctor stumbles into a tangle of international conspiracies.
Q-SQUARED, by Peter David. (Pocket, $22.) All creation is at stake when an old
enemy asks for help from "Star Trek"'s Captain Picard.
MISTRESS, by Amanda Quick. (Bantam, $19.95.) A former schoolteacher tries to
unmask a blackmailer.
A MAP OF THE WORLD, by Jane Hamilton. (Doubleday, $22.) When a dairy
farmer's wife makes a fatal mistake one morning, her life falls apart.
BLACK BETTY, by Walter Mosley. (Norton, $19.95.) The private eye Easy
Rawlins in pursuit of a troublemaking woman in 1961 Los Angeles.
Non-Fiction
THE AGENDA, by Bob Woodward. (Simon & Schuster, $24.) The inner workings
of the White House during the first year of the Clinton Administration.
EMBRACED BY THE LIGHT, by Betty J. Eadie with Curtis Taylor. (Gold Leaf
Press, $16.95.) A woman's near-death experience.
THE BOOK OF VIRTUES, by William J. Bennett. (Simon & Schuster, $27.50.)
Moral stories adapted from the Greeks, the Bible, folklore and elsewhere.
D-DAY, JUNE 6, 1944, by Stephen E. Ambrose. (Simon & Schuster, $30.) An
account of the Allied invasion of Normandy 50 years ago.
MIDNIGHT IN THE GARDEN OF GOOD AND EVIL, by John Berendt. (Random
House, $23.) The mysterious death of a young man in Savannah, Ga.
STANDING FIRM, by Dan Quayle. (HarperCollins/Zondervan, $25.) The former
Vice President recalls his life, especially during the Bush years.
ALL MY OCTOBERS, by Mickey Mantle with Mickey Herskowitz. (HarperCollins,
$23.) The legendary Yankee recalls the 12 World Series in which he played.
DAVE BARRY IS NOT MAKING THIS UP, by Dave Barry. (Crown, $20.) A
collection of humor pieces by the Pulitzer Prize-winning columnist.
LIFE OF THE PARTY, by Christopher Ogden. (Little, Brown, $24.95.) A biography
of Pamela Harriman, the United States Ambassador to France.
REBA: My Story, by Reba McEntire with Tom Carter. (Bantam, $22.95.) The
autobiography of the country singer.
SOUL MATES, by Thomas Moore. (HarperCollins, $25.) A psychotherapist
discusses love and relationships.
BEYOND PEACE, by Richard Nixon. (Random House, $23.) An agenda of foreign
and domestic policies for the United States to pursue in the post-cold war era.
MOON SHOT, by Alan Shepard and Deke Slayton with Jay Barbree and Howard
Benedict. (Turner, $21.95.) How Americans reached the moon in July 1969.
SAVED BY THE LIGHT, by Dannion Brinkley with Paul Perry. (Villard, $16.) An
account of two near-death experiences by a South Carolina businessman.
THE HALDEMAN DIARIES, by H.R. Haldeman. (Putnam, $27.50.) Notes made by
the man who was Richard Nixon's chief of staff from 1969 to 1973.
